intro: Paeonia officinalis var. villosa, commonly known as the hairy peony, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has compound, bipinnate leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The hairy peony is also valued for its medicinal properties, with its roots traditionally used in herbal remedies.
